repnme.cdata!: Venezuela - Low Income Barrios Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project achieved most of its
            objectives and is thus rated satisfactory. Among the most
            important lessons learned were the following: Thanks to
            adequate Government counterpart funding and its skillful
            mobilization by the Community and Municipal Development
            Foundation (FUNDACOMUN), the project was not held hostage to
            delayed disbursements from the special account, nor the lack
            of local counterpart funding. A highly satisfactory Bank
            performance helped secure the better-than-expected outcome.
            More resources for supervision in a situation of uncertainty
            allows for an intensive and proactive approach to build
            Bank/borrower trust and steer a project through an uncertain
            macro-context, such as that experienced by Venezuela. Staff
            continuity involving experienced and skilled individuals on
            both the borrower and Bank sides cemented relationships and
            contributed to project success. Project monitoring should be
            given priority at the outset of implementation, and
            constantly highlighted during supervision missions. Projects
            that can make only fractional improvements to enormous
            problems such as Venezuela's urban barrios should be
            consolidated by a follow-on operation and an active sector
            dialogue to help establish the basis for long-term solutions
            to large-scale sector problems.

Venezuela - Low Income Barrios
            Improvement Project

5082204.trustfund:
TF027093-PHRD-SECOND LOW INCOME BARRIOS
            IMPROVEMENT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!: Venezuela - Low Income Barrios Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objectives of the project are:
            to improve living conditions in low-income barrios, to
            develop the planning, administrative and executive
            capabilities of the municipalities - in support of the
            Venezuelan government's decentralization policy, and to
            strengthen the administrative and technical capacity of the
            Foundation for Community and Municipal Development
            (FUNDACOMUN).  The project will consist of: (1) an
            infrastructure improvements component which will finance the
            construction of basic infrastructure and purchase equipment
            to extend or improve municipal services such as water
            supply, sewerage, electricity, drainage, street paving, and
            garbage collection; (2) an institutional development
            component which will support the improvement of
            municipalities' institutional capacity and the
            strengthening of FUNDACOMUN's institutional capacity.

docna.cdata!: Venezuela - Low Income Barrios Improvement Project

display_title.display_title:
Venezuela - Low Income Barrios
            Improvement Project
